reviews.text: The Aquarium in Barcelona has a great layout, a lot of educational listings, videos, and tanks to see! My favorite part was the stingray tank, be sure to crawl underneath it and have them fly over your head. I think it was a very fun and interactive aquarium!

It's a good activity for the family when in Barcelona. The children will love it although the ticket is really pricey. What isn't worth it is the guide they sell for 3 euros. It is more like an advertisement brochure than an actual guide.  
For an adult, the only thing that is unusual is the tunnel that you walk with the aquarium above you!! Other than that, nothing yoy haven't seen elsewhere..
This aquarium is always a fun stop with kids. It's a little old and a little small, but a good time was had by all.

The place are good, very recommended for family with kids, very informative and interactive place. not so many people at that time.
when we visit, the travelator are not working.
It took us 45 minutes to see everything, 1 EUR per minute. I expected much more. Nothing special. Not worth the money for sure.

On of the best Zoo experiences we’ve ever had.  Park was wide and built like a great City Park with a Zoo thrown in!  Easy to navigate and the ability to see exhibits on multiple sides.  We went in March in midst of pandemic so it wasn’t crowded or fully opened.  However,  I still feel that we received more than our money’s worth.  

Playground and mini mountain is well worth it for little ones who get tired of reading!
Not the biggest aquarium around but has enough attractions to be interesting. I wish there ware free maps for the admission price rather than a 3 euro guidebook .

We spent a couple hours here when it rained one afternoon. It is a normal aquarium so I wouldn't take the time to go here unless like us, you need a way to kill time due to inclement weather. It's OK but no different than any other aquarium.
annoying photographers on the entrance, poor exhibition. We were waiting for fish feeding but there was not this even. No normal food to eat, only fast food.

A lot of kinds of fish and sharks. Simply beautiful! 
You have the boardwalk and the marina next to the place, you should go there..

Unfortunately, we were disappointed at barcelona aquarium, it was just an aquarium with normal water animals behind the glass, not even a bit more. and so expensive,  you can finish your tour in just half an hour,  it is so dark inside ,and its forbidden to use your camera flash light ,so the photos we took inside were so dark and blury, not recommended at all.
A great aquarium with a great range of species on display. A nice place to spend a good few hours. Particularly loved the Freshwater displays strangely enough but I would highly reccomend a visit.

Very sad to see the animals confined in so small spaces.. sharks should have more room.. the saddest was to see the pingouins packed in a very little space with no daylight or outdoor space. Same for the rays that are swimming in a box in 10cm of water... children and parents are most likely not respecting the animals by taping the windows and taking photos with flash ! The auditorium smells like mold and is very dusty.
My 2 yo kids enjoyed seeing the fish and running around in the semi dark rooms. The whole place would need a bit of a renovation and the poor penguins more space.

We have been to Barcelona but never visited the entire tour around flows and tells a great story seeing all the different fishes and corals etc and the walk through the shark tank raises hairs on your neck very enjoyable great for kids with interactive bits as well

It was a really amaysing experience.

Wonderful feeling. Under the sharks and other fishes, really beautiful.

Wow! What a great experience for those wanting a little thrill seeking! Get up close and personal with 6 foot sharks!!!!!!!!!!!!!! So good and the penguins were adorable!! There's great interactive areas for kids as well. Two Thumbs Up!

honestly, ive been to maybe 4/5 different aquariums and sealife centers but this was in the top 2 by far!! Amazing staff! Awesome welcome photo and the sea life on display were active and looked healthy and strong!

I visited this place with kids .
Kids enjoyed watching live sharks .
Different fishes,
Live octopus ,
.
I will highly recommend this place to every family who want to visit Barcelona .

Unfortunately, from one of the best aquariums in Europe some years ago, it became just an aquarium - water animals behind the glass, not even a bit more. Scheduled "animations" are just feeding times with no explanations: a person comes (or dives in case of big aquarium) and throws food into the water - that's it. Nothing interactive, no tasks for kids. Instead the stuff is occupied with taking pictures of visitors and selling them. We felt that this aquarium has forgotten what its role is: explaining about nature, oceans, animals, their problems, etc. A pity!
Very beautiful place, but prices are a little bit too high considering the size of the aquarium and options offered.
It's a really nice place to visit. Kids had lots of fun. There was a wide variety of sea animals. You could spend as much time as you wish going back and forth.

Went shark cage diving.
Was well worth the money!
Instructor was great.
I’m inexperienced and he did a great job explaining everything despite a language gap.
I’d absolutely do it again 
I’m giving the aquarium itself 4 stars because I felt some tanks were too small for the fish, though that could just mean they are healthy and growing
And the eels in the main tank need more structure
It’s sad seeing so many with their heads down in the grass because that’s all they can find. It’s not natural . 
Great experience overall
I’d absolutely recommend!
Get the moray eels some cover please!

We decided to have a 'different' Valentines day and booked the diving with sharks, our instructor, who's name I'm afraid I can't recall, was amazing, she made sure my other half was happy and feeling safe, the dive into the tank with all the marine life and accompanied by the sharks was truly an amazing experience, made so much better by the wonderful and caring instructor, she could not have been better, the whole experience was a great way to prove that sharks are not to be feared in the way that many of us do, if you can afford it and have the time, it's a truly incredible experience

Well worth a visit while in Barcelona. There is plenty to see for adults and children alike.It is not terribly crowded
and is well laid out for the flow of tourists.

If you want a little thrill mixed with some fascinating views from the base of your fingertips this is for you, 150€ well worth the time including the bonuses they don't tell you, this Aquarium is one of my favorites and I'd do it again.
We really enjoyed visiting the aquarium. I especially enjoyed the overhead tank tunnels which were great for photos!

Fantastic great for everyone the staff so helpful really good For children and groups access is really god for people who have mobility issues and a lift to take you upstairs plenty to see and do I highly recommend this place

The aquarium like most aquariums has a variety of species with some unusual ones but the way it is laid out for display is a little different from a lot of others we have visited. There are moving walkways through the tunnels which are nice to ride as find it easy to look at the species as we move along without needing to find a gap in the crowds to be able to view comfortably as the day of our visit a Saturday was quite a busy day. We arrived by metro and was about a 10-minute walk to the aquarium from the metro station.
It was amazing experience to we to see so many sea creatures ! We've learned a lot about the sea life . Everything was very nice though we find the Aquarium is  smaller than our expectation !
It was nice and very beautiful. Will do it again if we have kids, because it's very open it's without a gids.
Good day out and can easily spend a few hours there for a good price, I do wish there was more communication on the feeding times and where to go though.
Nice place. A little bit small for so many people. Best attractions the sharks and the penguins. But too expensive!
Good place for aquarium. Perfekt for family . Your kids will love it and You will spend lot of time inside.

This has the most beautiful and varied aquariums I have ever seen. Loved spending time here. I would have like more opportunity to sit and watch the fish during my visit by supplying movable stools for example.

It's a great aquarium. It posses a vast variety of different species and information concerning them. There are activities (feeding times) throughout the day which keeps visitors entertained. Only wish the entrance photo was a bit cheaper or free. The entrance photo is more than half the entrance fee.

25 years old, and went with my GF since we were rained in and wanted to do something that’s indoors that was not a museum. We had the Barcelona Card so got €4 discounts on each ticket which was not bad, but still not worth the price. 

Overall, the aquarium was sub par. Nothing extraordinary or worthwhile. Just fish, occasional sharks, and a small penguin exhibit. Theres more but that’s all that I can recall since it was pretty boring. 

Honestly take your kids to the harbor or port and go on a boat tour. Not worth the admission fee.

Beautiful arrange sections covering all of the globe. Relaxed atmosphere, lots of children loving it and showing it. I don't understand some of the reviewers question the ticket price in terms of value-for-money; it must cost an absolute fortune to lovingly maintain all these separate environments. Ticket cost of 20e is less than a ticket for relatively anonymous band concert.

Way overpriced for what it offers. We visited with a toddler who really liked Explora, but half of the plays in it were broken or didn’t work. Overall the whole place is quite worn out and in high demand of renovation and good maintenance.
The selection of sealife was exquisite and the walk through the glass tunnel was mesmerizing and really relaxing.
Small aquarium. I think a little over priced for what you get to see. Wouldn’t go again but did keep my daughter busy for a little while
It was really a wonderful aquarium. Would really recommend others to visit it atleast once in a lifetime.
Very nice experience for the kids . A very good location to visit, when the weather is bad outside .
This was below my expectations besides tthey dont let one of the spouse to go upstairs in the cafeteria without a ticket.

It was ok in general! There were a variety of fishes, with the sharks of course to take the whole glory! It's a quiet good experience, but in my opinion,  it's a little bit more expensive than it deserves..the ticket is 21€, and i believe it really worths about 10-15€ maximum!
1st visit of our citybreak at Barcelona and it was amazing. Loved the 80m tunnel and the jellyfish tanks! Penguins were fatty and well nurished. Bf wished for more amphibians.
We had amazing time, it was really fullfeeling experiences, we saw how the sharks are feed. We saw penguins different kind of fish. In the aquarium there is a shop, you can shop souvenirs there.
It was 21€ for nothing👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻 It was dirty the service very bad no reason for the time and the money to go there!

We arrived around 10.30 am (30 min after opening). right after we passed the gates, we didn't know where to go. no signs or hints on how to plan your journey through this place. so we went up the stairs, we saw some fishes, some facts etc, then we went to the room with rays and penguins. we stayed there until 11.30, beacuse we knew, there will be penguings feeding (again no information about that on walls or anywhere - we've heard some communicate from speakers, also in English, but I didn't undserstand a word). so far everything was fine. 
we left the penguins feeding little earlier, beacuse we didn't know where to go, and we wanted to see the sharks feeding at 12.00. so we went downstairs where we were forced to take some photography. then we quickly moved through some small aquariums/exhibitions (without looking at them or reading the information) and achieved the big aquarium with sharks, rays and other fishes. aaaaaand again - no information about "the feeding", no sign. and this event (shark feeding) is why we went there on Friday, instead of some other day, and why we came only 30 minutes after opening. 
So... we've heard again some speakers communicate and again no understandable word. So we waited at the big aquarium from 11.50 till around 12.45. Nothing happened. so we decided to go to finish and then start again from the beginning to see all the staff that we've missed (because we were in hurry to see sharks feeding). 
of course right after we left the area, a lady tried to sell us the photography from the very beginning and right after this, it was the point that I couldn't make it further. We wanted to go back downstairs again, but the line for the forced photography was so LONG, I said "I'm leaving. I'm not going to wait another 30-45 minuted to take photo I don't want.". And of course I was mad, beacuse I was hyped for the sharks feeding. :(((
Afterall, I was pretty disappointed - wanted to see a lot, didn't see much.
Not one of the really big Aquariums but a nice one to visit and the surrounding area is very good to visit also.

Fantastic visit at the aquarium for the kids. The tunnel is an attraction not to be missed;
The play area at the end is also very nice for them
Extraordinary . It was a pleasant trip and we will back again.  Is see first aquarium with tunnel under water I see.🤗🤗🤗🤗
This was a great day with the kids. Really nicely layer out aquarium, the highlight for the kids was the fish feeding pool, they loved it.

The Barcelona Aquarium is the worst aquarium I have been to and the worst value for money I have ever received. It is small, outdated and crowded and employees are rude. The only nice bit was the tunnel with the sharks, however, it's super small. There are so many much better things to do with 20 Euro / person in Barcelona. I would skip this 'attraction'.

Perhaps this would be good for families but I really did not enjoy it. 

Why on earth would you want to go look at confined creatures while you are in a beautiful city with endless outdoor exploration? Regardless my friends wanted to go, and since I have never been I joined. I will never do that again. It was a nice set up, I guess. But it was busy, packed with people, and well it hurts my hear to see all the sea life locked up in a cage. I think it is also a bit pricey for what it was in comparison to other things I did. 

I would not recommend. I would recommend you explore the outdoors!
Great location, very interesting for kids. Fine value for money, altough souvenirs are too expensive.

I took my 11 years old daughter to experience the activity if diving with Sharks at the Aquarium in Barcelona. She has done many experiences with sea animals in other parts of the world but this one, we both agree, it has been the best one ! The person was very patience and took as much time as need it to make sure she could swim with sharks around her. It was incredible! We couldn't have asked for a better person to guide her! My husband and I wish we had done it as well. My daughter is telling her friends and showing them all her videos. They all want to go there to experience the same!!

Very nice experience but quite not enough
I hoped to see more, but in one hour and a half i finished seeing everithing in the aquarium.
Nothing special, very crowded, missing cloakroom, available only few locking boxes. Very expensive, less diversity of fish.

The amount of species at the aquarium is impressive, with some niche species rarely found at other aquariums. Most of the tanks were well suited for their aquatic counterparts though some were definitely over crowded - even if the filtration is good this clearly made some of the fish uneasy. The main Aquarium was huge and seeing ocean-sunfish and sea dragon for the first time really made this worthwhile. Overall the experience was good, the aquarium was extremely busy but this is too be expected.

This is located in the old port or old harbor area but is not the easily accessible through public transport - especially if it is an holiday. Apart from that, the collection and maintenance is good. Shark pool was the best. Could be more user friendly though.
very funny visit at the BCN Aquarium, the shark pool is worth the trip! All the experiences I had are fond of good memories about that great city!
Everything was perfect except people who weren't following the rules, nice ambient, a bit hot inside

Went with my grown up daughter and we really enjoyed it. Loads of photo opportunities with sharks moral eels and rays. Very interesting and lots of things to keep children entertained. Would definitely recommend

The interpretation was dated, limited, poorly legible, and, at times, biologically incorrect. The aquarium had the mandatory display on the adverse effects of single use plastics on marine life. However, in both the cafeteria and at the many vending machines, it was not possible to buy a beverage in anything except a single use plastic container. Aquarium staff were only present at "revenue generating" stations (group photo, cafeteria, large gift shop) and entirely absent from the display and aquariam areas. I was left with the feeling that the Barcelona aquarium exists to generate revenue and not promote education or marine conservation. Barcelona has many many beautiful and engaging attractions. The aquarium is not one of them.

Aquarium experience here was quite good. I liked the range of different fishes, sharks and stingrays that we could see. It was bigger than what I anticipated. We had quite an enjoyable experience and would recommend it to anyone. I went with parents but it is also suitable for people with children as well. Prices are reasonable. The only issue was of how far it was to take to get to it as it was beside the port/boat area.

This aquarium has a very comprehensive collection of Mediterranean fish and other marine life, and an always fascinating Oceanarium with an 80 metre long tunnel that allows you to see big sharks, rays and other ocean fish close up. However, the highlight for us was a series of tanks displaying breathtakingly beautiful tropical corals and anemones, especially interesting for us in advance of a visit to the Great Barrier Reef.

This is an excellent aquarium. Their lighting of the fish is wonderful. There is such a variety of fish. You can buy a bottle and feed the koi a special food. That’s really an experience. My favorite was the stingray tank. The rays respond to your voice and show off. Of course the tunnel you walk through with  all the sharks and fish is amazing.

We visited with our 3 1/2  year old grandson. While maybe not the most spectacular aquarium we’ve seen, it’s a good size for little ones, and  he absolutely loved it. He didn’t want to leave. Very kid friendly! We especially enjoyed it seeing it through his eyes! From an adult perspective, the displays are also beautifully designed.
You will be amazed about everything there, definitely a place to visit while you are in Barcelona. All types of fish and and sea animals
very nice atmosphere and easy to find, good destination for families i like how the hang fake jelly fish so it could seem real :)
the ticket is expensive even for a family with younger kids less than 6 years old, and sadly there is no discount for people with disabilities.
Too small, very disappointing & far too expensive. 10€ maximum for this is the correct price. Aquarium in Valencia was so much better
It's a nice attraction to visit (for a couple of hours) , especially with children. At the port, near a metro station, mall, cable car, etc.. Rememberable!
Very small aquarium and expensive for the things that has to show.. The only interesting thing was the glass tube where you can see the sharks and the penguins at the end. Nothing more!
It was a fun visit to the Aquarium with our 8 year old kid. Good variety of species and well maintained aquarium.
This is a fantastic aquarium. Despite the price it was absolutely brilliant. The fish had good size tanks. The gift shop is massive.

Beautiful place without a doubt but not suitable for little children (under 5-6) and definitely not worth the price (25 euro per adult). You should only visit if you REALLY like fish and other sea creatures.

Not value for money. The tour guide said it was one of the best aquariums in Europe, so we visited it. It was 71 Euros for 4 of us - 2 adults and 2 children.

Our downfall was that we have been to amazing aquariums like uSharka marine world and Two oceans in South Africa. We were expecting similar.

Unfortunately, this aquarium is no were near these world class aquariums. The escalators and travelators were not working. 

Nothing inspiring can be said about the experience at this aquarium.

I love it , all good conditions, everything was good, except the raya fish tank! please take of the the tank of Raya Fishes in the middle of the room, kids going inside of that and screaming is a bad idea! They must feel stressed all the time! Please move them into a serious big tank, just to inform that detail
Anyway, I took amazing photos, so people can see real thing !
No so big one but its worth for the money. Those who are coming with kids can try this. Nice views from outside and you can take a walk to the famous Vasco da gama bridge from there.

It's over hyped - in simple terms.. IT was mentioned in the website that feeding show of all fishes happens on Tuesday and Friday, so i took off from work on a Tuesday and went with my younger one. But no feeding happened for sharks, etc and when i asked the staffs they were not sure of feeding... just telling me you can wait to see.. but after 2 hours also nothing happened and some staff said they will announce before feeding time.. but no announcement , nothing.. its just a total waste of time and money..

Our family really enjoyed the visit, we liked the small tanks with micro-environments from different seas and the huge tank. We don't see autowalk (moving walkway) as an improvement, it is rather inconvenient to walk on uneven surface although it was turned off during our visit. We couldn't find any species' descriptions at the large tank. At the age of mobile phones, we found it disturbing that you try to charge for a group photo that is taken "for free" at the entrance. We liked the playground, but it was to dark to move safely with children. Entrance to the Aquarium is not visibly marked, you should put some signs down the road/port.
Great aquarium, well kept fishes, the piranhas and sharks were excellent.  I highly recommend especially for kids
Very good place for kids and adults too. Great aquarium with diferent sea animals and fishes. Great place for family in Barselona.

We traveled to L'Aquarium de Barcelona on 28th November, Thursday morning with our 2 kids & parent. We have been greeted by the entrance staff, & what we observed that all of the staffs were friendly. The marine exhibits were very attractive & informative. They have various of fun activities for kids, such as fish feeding with playground at both indoor & outdoor. We had our brunch at the food court located at the first floor. The price were reasonable & worth the money. Overall, as a family really enjoyed the experience & visit. Highly recommended.
I am a huge lover of fish and aquatic sea life. I was able to get through in 30 minutes very disappointing
It was definitely the worst aquarium I have ever been to. I had to promise a trip to Atlanta to make up for how bad it was.
Staff needs to learn how to use expedia tickets via mobile. It was a hassle getting in cause they didn't know what to do. Other than that aquarium was Fantastic!!!!!
Great aquarium! My favorite was the octopus...the coolest species. I really enjoyed watching the exotic and colorful fish swim around. I even saw Nemo! A must see while visiting Barcelona!
nice hous, perfekt make, servie perfekt to! maby more different Things for kids and more Information
Was magical. I enjoyed it so much. I will recommend to anyone who loves nature. I would visit again in future.
Very good impressions. A lot of aquariums with different types of fishes and other sea life. More sharks. Big territory. Good food. Big shop with souvenirs

We had a fun time at the aquarium. The highlight is the conveyer belt that takes you around the tanks and how part of the tank continues to overhead. I wouldn't go out of my way to see this aquarium, but if you are a fan of aquariums, it's definitely worth a visit.
Me and my boyfriend have been to many aquariums as it’s one of our favorite things to do while traveling! It was a really fun experience and I’m glad we went. The price is great too!

My boyfriend and I visited the aquarium in november. It is a nice place to visit if you don't have any similar experience to compare with. A part of the aquarium was closed for mentenance. However we saw different species of fish (some little sharks, ), but it didn't exceed my expectations.
It was very nice and very interesting visit. The sharks and the big sort of fish was amazing.so if you visit barcelona it’s something interesting
Great place for observing all kind of fishes, including sharps. It is located in a great zone and you can also enjoy a nice walk near the water.

The instalations are ok. The animals seemed well treated and there is a big variety of species. However, the ticket is very expensive for what it is.
The aquarium was full of people, specially kids, so a lot of things we had to skip because it was impossible to see them
Overall it is fine but overpriced as many other places in Barcelona. From advertisement we thought it will be best we ever seen, but we saw better.
